channel.title: Didnt know where to post so
channel.description:
hi, ive been wondering to make my own forum. but now the question is: how? ive heard vbulletin os good but cost alot and downloading it as warez is risky (ive heard) .
so any1 out there that could help me out?

item.source: Didnt know where to post so

item.title: Didnt know where to post so
item.dc:creator: @nicodk nicodk
item.description:
@nicodk wrote:

PHP 4.1.0 or higher. The following are required to be set correctly in php.ini:

* the engine directive must be On.
* the magic_quotes_sybase directive must be set to Off.
* the session.save_path directive must be set to a valid directory, or empty.
* the file_uploads directive must be On.
* the upload_tmp_dir must be set to a valid directory, or empty. 


MySQL 3.23.28 or higher.

* at least 500 kilobytes of storage space in the database, although more is highly recommended.
* at least the following privileges: SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, ALTER, and INDEX.
* during installation and conversion, the CREATE and DROP privileges.

About six megabytes of storage space on the web server (more for attachments!).

that makes my brain spin…

Read full topic

item.title: Didnt know where to post so
item.dc:creator: @nicodk nicodk
item.description:
@nicodk wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:6, topic:61137”]All you need to do is get the php script that automatically sets up the forums with you specifying minimum information.
I would have recommended freehostia, but I tried to set a forum up for a mate and it wouldn’t accept the SQL database credentials. No idea why.

But to sum up, the easiest way is to use the auto installing php script.
Then you just need free hosting that allows PHP and provides a MySQL database.[/quote] in a language a noob can understand plz ?

Read full topic
item.source: Didnt know where to post so

item.title: Didnt know where to post so
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

All you need to do is get the php script that automatically sets up the forums with you specifying minimum information.
I would have recommended freehostia, but I tried to set a forum up for a mate and it wouldn’t accept the SQL database credentials. No idea why.

But to sum up, the easiest way is to use the auto installing php script.
Then you just need free hosting that allows PHP and provides a MySQL database.

Read full topic
